description: From Middle English westward, from Old English westweard.

adjectives.description: westward (comparative more westward, superlative most westward)

examples: […]  about a quarter of an hour before the time of sunset the westward clouds parted  […]

entries.meaning: Moving or oriented toward the west.
examples: Those who steer their westward course through the middle of the Propontis, may at once descry the high lands of Thrace and Bithynia, and never lose sight of the lofty summit of Mount Olympus, covered with eternal snows.

adverbs.description: westward (comparative more westward, superlative most westward)

entries.meaning: The western region or countries; the west.
examples: I name this to explain what I said before, of Ships being embay’d and lost here: this is when, coming from the Westward, they omit to keep a good Offing, or are taken short by contrary Winds  […]
